features.name: Fast Movement
features.desc: A bloodrager's land {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is faster than is normal for his {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} by 10 feet. This benefit applies only when he is wearing no armor, light armor, or medium armor, and not carrying a heavy load. Apply this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} before modifying the bloodrager's speed due to any armor worn or load carried. This bonus stacks with any other bonuses to the bloodrager's land speed.

features.name: Bloodline
features.desc:
Each bloodrager has a source of magic somewhere in his heritage that empowers his bloodrages, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. Sometimes this source reflects a distant blood relationship to a powerful being, or is due to an extreme event involving such a creature somewhere in his family's past. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways. A bloodrager must pick one bloodline upon taking his first level of bloodrager. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
The bloodrager gains bloodline powers at 1st level, 4th level, and every 4 levels thereafter. The bloodline powers a bloodrager gains are described in his chosen bloodline. For all spell-like bloodline powers, treat the character's bloodrager level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
At 6th level and every 3 levels thereafter, a bloodrager receives one bonus feat chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The bloodrager must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats. At 7th, 10th, 13th, and 16th levels, a bloodrager learns an additional spell derived from his bloodline.
If the bloodrager takes levels in another class that grants a bloodline, the bloodlines must be the same type.

features.name: Bloodrage
features.desc:
The bloodrager's source of internal power grants him the ability to bloodrage.
At 1st level, a bloodrager can bloodrage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. At each level after 1st, he can bloodrage for 2 additional rounds per day. Temporary increases to Constitution (such as those gained from bloodraging or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} like bear's endurance) don't increase the total number of rounds that a bloodrager can bloodrage per day. The total number of rounds of bloodrage per day is renewed after resting for 8 hours, although these hours need not be consecutive.
While in a bloodrage, a bloodrager gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, he takes a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. He also gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}. These temporary hit points are lost first when a character takes damage, disappear when the bloodrage ends, and are not replenished if the bloodrager enters a bloodrage again within 1 minute of his previous bloodrage.
If a bloodrager falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, his bloodrage immediately ends, placing him in peril of death.
Bloodrage counts as the barbarian's rage class feature for the purpose of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} prerequisites, feat abilities, magic item abilities, and spell effects.

features.name: Bloodrager Proficiencies
features.desc: Bloodragers are proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields). A bloodrager can cast bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing light armor or medium armor without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. This does not affect the arcane spell failure chance for arcane spells received from other classes. Like other arcane spellcasters, a bloodrager wearing heavy armor or wielding a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure if the spell in question has somatic components.

features.name: Uncanny Dodge
features.desc:
The character can react to danger before her senses would normally allow her to do so. She cannot be caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}, nor does she lose her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} if the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacker{/g} is invisible. She still loses her Dexterity bonus to AC if immobilized. A character with this ability can still lose her Dexterity bonus to AC if an opponent successfully uses the feint {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} against her.
If a character already has uncanny dodge from a different class, she automatically gains improved uncanny dodge instead.

features.name: Blood Sanctuary
features.desc: At 3rd level, due to the power of his blood, a bloodrager can stand confidently amid the effects of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} cast by himself or his allies. He gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against spells that he or an ally casts.

features.name: Improved Uncanny Dodge
features.desc:
The character can no longer be {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanked{/g}.
This defense denies another rogue the ability to sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} the character by flanking her, unless the attacker has at least four more rogue levels than the target does.

features.name: Damage Reduction
features.desc: At 7th level, a bloodrager gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Subtract 1 from the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} the bloodrager takes each time he is dealt damage from a weapon or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g}. At 10th level, and every 3 levels thereafter, this damage reduction increases by 1 point. Damage Reduction can reduce damage to 0, but not below 0.

features.name: Greater Bloodrage
features.desc:
At 11th level, when a bloodrager enters a bloodrage, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} increases to +3 and the morale bonus on his Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} increases to +3. In addition, upon entering a bloodrage, the bloodrager can cast a bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} he knows of 2nd level or lower as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. The spell must have a "{g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}Touch{/g}" or "Self" range. This use consumes a bloodrager spell slot, as if he had cast the spell; he must have the spell slot available to take advantage of this effect.
Greater bloodrage counts as the barbarian's greater rage ability for the purposes of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} prerequisites, feat abilities, magic item abilities, and spell effects.

features.name: Indomitable Will
features.desc: At 14th level, a bloodrager gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist Enchantment spells{/g} while bloodraging. This bonus stacks with all other modifiers, including the morale bonus on Will saves he also receives during his bloodrage.

features.name: Tireless Bloodrage
features.desc: At 17th level, a bloodrager no longer becomes fatigued at the end of his bloodrage.

features.name: Mighty Bloodrage
features.desc: At 20th level, when a bloodrager enters a bloodrage, the morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} increases to +4, and the morale bonus on his Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} increases to +4. Furthermore, the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} he can apply to himself at the beginning of a bloodrage due to the greater bloodrage class feature is not limited to only spells of 2nd level or lower.

features.name: Fast Rider
features.desc: The bloodrider is adept at pushing his mount to its limit. The {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} of any mount the bloodrager rides increases by 10 feet.

features.name: Animal Companion
features.desc: Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.

features.name: Feral Mount
features.desc: At 5th level, the bloodrider gains the service of a feral mount. This ability functions as the druid's animal companion, using the bloodrager's level – 4 as his effective druid level. This companion must be one he is capable of riding and suitable as a mount. Whenever a bloodrider is bloodraging, this feral mount gains a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.

features.name: Unfettered Fury
features.desc: At 3rd level, a greenrager's fury allows him to move through undergrowth with frightening {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and grace. He can move through any sort difficult terrain at his normal speed and without taking {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} or suffering any other impairment.

features.name: Summoning Rager
features.desc: At 6th level, a greenrager's magic unlocks the secrets of summoning allies from nature. He adds summon nature's ally I to his list of 1st-level bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} known as a bonus spell, as if it were a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} bloodrager spell. At 7th level, he adds summon nature's ally II as a bonus 2nd-level bloodrager spell, at 10th level he adds summon nature's ally III as a bonus 3rd level bloodrager spell, and at 13th level he adds summon nature's ally IV as a bonus 4th-level bloodrager spell.

features.name: Summoning Rager
features.desc: At 6th level, a greenrager's magic unlocks the secrets of summoning allies from nature. He adds summon nature's ally I to his list of 1st-level bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} known as a bonus spell, as if it were a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} bloodrager spell. At 7th level, he adds summon nature's ally II as a bonus 2nd-level bloodrager spell, at 10th level he adds summon nature's ally III as a bonus 3rd level bloodrager spell, and at 13th level he adds summon nature's ally IV as a bonus 4th-level bloodrager spell.

features.name: Summoning Rager
features.desc: At 6th level, a greenrager's magic unlocks the secrets of summoning allies from nature. He adds summon nature's ally I to his list of 1st-level bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} known as a bonus spell, as if it were a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} bloodrager spell. At 7th level, he adds summon nature's ally II as a bonus 2nd-level bloodrager spell, at 10th level he adds summon nature's ally III as a bonus 3rd level bloodrager spell, and at 13th level he adds summon nature's ally IV as a bonus 4th-level bloodrager spell.

features.name: Summoning Rager
features.desc: At 6th level, a greenrager's magic unlocks the secrets of summoning allies from nature. He adds summon nature's ally I to his list of 1st-level bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} known as a bonus spell, as if it were a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} bloodrager spell. At 7th level, he adds summon nature's ally II as a bonus 2nd-level bloodrager spell, at 10th level he adds summon nature's ally III as a bonus 3rd level bloodrager spell, and at 13th level he adds summon nature's ally IV as a bonus 4th-level bloodrager spell.

features.name: Furious Summoning
features.desc: At 9th level, creatures summoned by the bloodrager's summon nature's ally {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and gain the druid's woodland stride ability. At 11th level, this bonus increases to +6. At 20th level, it increases to +8.

features.name: Primal Choices
features.desc: At 4th level and every 4 levels thereafter, a primalist can choose to take either his bloodline power or two barbarian rage powers. If the primalist chooses rage powers, those rage powers can be used in conjunction with his bloodrage, and his bloodrager level acts as his barbarian level when determining the effect of those bloodrage powers and any prerequisites. Any other prerequisites for a rage power must be met before a primalist can choose it. This ability does not count as the rage power class feature for determining {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} prerequisites and other requirements.

features.name: Blood of Life
features.desc: A {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spelleater{/g}'s blood empowers him to slowly recover from his wounds. At 2nd level, while bloodraging a spelleater gains fast {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} 1. At 7th level and every 3 levels thereafter, this increases by 1 (to a maximum of {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 6 at 19th level).

features.name: Spell Eating
features.desc: At 5th level, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spelleater{/g} can consume spell slots for an extra dose of {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g}. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the spelleater can consume one unused bloodrager spell slot to heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for each level of the spell slot consumed.

features.name: Weapon and Armor Proficiency
features.desc: A steelblood gains proficiency in heavy armor. A steelblood can cast bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing heavy armor without incurring an {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}.

features.name: Indomitable Stance
features.desc: At 1st level, a steelblood gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} against overrun combat maneuvers. He also gains a +1 bonus to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against charging creatures.

features.name: Armored Swiftness
features.desc: At 2nd level, a steelblood moves faster in medium and heavy armor. When wearing medium or heavy armor, a steelblood can move 5 feet faster than normal in that armor, to a maximum of his unencumbered {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.

features.name: Blood Deflection
features.desc: At 7th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} a steelblood can sacrifice a bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slot to gain a deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} equal to the level of the spell sacrificed. The deflection bonus lasts until the end of his next turn.

features.name: Armor Training
features.desc: At 5th level, a steelblood learns to be more {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}maneuverable{/g} while wearing armor. Whenever he is wearing armor, he reduces the armor {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} by 1 (to a maximum of 0) and increases the maximum {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} allowed by his armor by 1. Every 4 levels thereafter (9th, 13th, and 17th), these bonuses increase by 1, to a maximum 4-point reduction of the {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g} and a +4 increase of the {g|Encyclopedia:Max_Dex_Bonus}maximum Dexterity bonus{/g}. This ability stacks with the fighter class feature of the same name.

features.name: Armor Training
features.desc:
Starting at 3rd level, a fighter learns to be more {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}maneuverable{/g} while wearing armor. Whenever he is wearing armor, he reduces the armor {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} by 1 (to a minimum of 0) and increases the maximum {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} allowed by his armor by 1. Every four levels thereafter (7th, 11th, and 15th), these bonuses increase by +1 each time, to a maximum –4 reduction of the {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g} and a +4 increase of the {g|Encyclopedia:Max_Dex_Bonus}maximum Dexterity bonus{/g} allowed.
In addition, a fighter can also move at his normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} while wearing medium armor. At 7th level, a fighter can move at his normal speed while wearing heavy armor.

features.name: Bloodline
features.desc:
Each bloodrager has a source of magic somewhere in his heritage that empowers his bloodrages, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. Sometimes this source reflects a distant blood relationship to a powerful being, or is due to an extreme event involving such a creature somewhere in his family's past. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways. A bloodrager must pick one bloodline upon taking his first level of bloodrager. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
The bloodrager gains bloodline powers at 1st level, 4th level, and every 4 levels thereafter. The bloodline powers a bloodrager gains are described in his chosen bloodline. For all spell-like bloodline powers, treat the character's bloodrager level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
At 6th level and every 3 levels thereafter, a bloodrager receives one bonus feat chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The bloodrager must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats. At 7th, 10th, 13th, and 16th levels, a bloodrager learns an additional spell derived from his bloodline.
If the bloodrager takes levels in another class that grants a bloodline, the bloodlines must be the same type.

features.name: Hatred Against Evil
features.desc: At 5th level reformed fiend gains +1 to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against evil creatures while in bloodrage. This {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} increases by +1 for every 5 levels.

features.name: Damage Reduction (Reformed Fiend)
features.desc: At 7th level reformed fiend's gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 3/evil. At 10th level, and every 3 levels thereafter, this {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction increases by 3 point. Damage Reduction can reduce damage to 0, but not below 0.

features.name: Way of Redemption
features.desc: At 11th level all reformed fiend's {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} become good aligned.

features.name: Mixed Bloodline
features.desc: Mixed-blood rager can use his strange heritage to invoke powers of different bloodlines. Once per day, he can choose a bloodline: until the next time he chooses a bloodline, he gains all the advantages of the chosen bloodline.

features.name: Second Mixed Bloodline
features.desc: Starting at 4th level, Mixed-blood rager can choose a second bloodline to invoke at the same time.
